nodes.bodyText: exclusion-file
This option is different from specifying exclusion file to filter linkage errors. Did you mean something further than that?
OK. Didn't realize we were already using exclusion-file. Still write-as-exclusion-file isn't clear. Other names?
Updated as output-linkage-errors-as-exclusion-file.
delete
Fixed.
can you use try with resources here?
It did not work. XMLEventWriter is not Autocloseable.
delete "to"
Deleted.
It might be reasonable to combine the writing and the parsing into a single class.
The writer and the parser do not share logic. But I'm also ok to combine the two into ExclusionFiles. Do you think it's good idea?
ExclusionFiles.write sounds better than ExclusionFilesWriter.write so yes.
Merged the two files into ExclusionFiles.

Got
bytes length:0
XML input: 
InputStream available: 0

https://fusion.corp.google.com/invocation/88f8ef04-b8e5-447d-8ee1-c6e9f553ab7a/buildlogs?target=cloud-opensource-java%2Fgcp_windows%2Fpresubmit&drilldownTab=tests
private
Fixed.
I think we need to stop using multimaps. We need a better data type here.
How about LinkageErrors class that has a field Multimap<SymbolProblem, ClassFile> errors? Anyway, such change is outside the scope of this PR.
You shouldn't need to do this. It should be enough to set that system property to point to the class you want.
Removed the unnecessary logic.

By convention this file name would end in .rng; that is, "linkage-checker-exclusion.rng"
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RELAX_NG#Filename_extensions
Thanks. Updated.
Can you cut the long argument down to one or two words? Three at most.
Updated this to output-exclusion-file
This should be renamed similarly. Maybe we can have inputExclusionFile and outputExclusionFile? or just outputExclusions?
outputExclusionFile sounds nice. Thank you.
This surprises me. I thought you could do both in one run.

Updated this to always output the linkage errors to stdout.
I had thought the output is not wanted when the writeAsExclusionFile is specified.

This is the sort of use of multimap that confuses me. Is the classFile the source or the target? It's unclear how it's encoded or what it means. This should be a Collection and the symbol problem should know the source and the target. What we're writing into the file is a list of linkage errors. Why aren't we passing a list of linkage errors into this method?
